text: Purpose: Official process to deactivate an identity card when it is no longer valid, such as in cases of death, surrender of nationality, duplicate cards, or divorce (for foreign spouse). Scenarios: 1. Cancellation Due to Death: Immediate family members (parent, sibling, child, or spouse) of a deceased Pakistani citizen or ex-Pakistani can apply for cancellation. Requires CNIC/NICOP of relative and death certificate from Union Council. 2. Surrender of Nationality: For citizens who have renounced Pakistani nationality after acquiring a foreign passport and are not allowed dual nationality. 3. Dual Nationality or Reacquired Pakistani Nationality: Ex-Pakistanis who reacquire Pakistani nationality or whose country becomes eligible for dual nationality. 4. Divorce (Foreign Spouse Only): Pakistani spouse can apply for cancellation of ex-spouse’s POC after divorce. 5. Duplicate Cards (DUP Status): Citizens holding multiple ID cards must contact NADRA or email dup.op@nadra.gov.pk to clear duplicates. How to Apply at NADRA Registration Center (NRC): - Visit any NADRA Registration Center. - Receive a token. - Photograph, fingerprints, and signature will be captured. - Data will be entered and printed for review. - Get the form attested by a blood relative or gazetted officer and submit back to NRC. Note: “DUP” status means duplicate identity cards exist; applicant must request DUP clearance to retain the valid one.

text: Purpose: Registers a child in NADRA’s database and establishes their parentage. It is a vital identity document for all children in Pakistan. Eligibility: - Must provide proof of birth (Union Council birth certificate). - At least one parent must have CNIC or NICOP. - For children up to 1 year old, can apply online via Pak ID Mobile App. - For children older than 1 year, application must be made at NADRA Registration Center (NRC). Applying via Pak ID Mobile App: 1. Log in or create a Pak ID account. 2. Select “Issuance of Identity Document” → “Child Registration Certificate (CRC)”. 3. Provide parent’s 13-digit ID number and start the application. 4. Upload child’s photograph and required documents. 5. Provide digital signature and verify one parent’s fingerprints. 6. Review details and submit application. Applying via NADRA Registration Center (NRC): 1. Visit NRC and receive a token. 2. Photograph, fingerprints, and signature captured. 3. Review printed form and get it attested by gazetted officer (if spouse not present). 4. If both parents are present, attestation not required. Legal Note: Under Section 9 of the NADRA Ordinance 2000, every child must be registered within one month of birth. Pak ID allows online CRC registration for children up to one year of age.

text: Purpose: An official document verifying family composition as recorded in NADRA’s database. Commonly used for embassy and verification purposes but not a legal document. Categories: 1. By Birth: Shows parents and siblings. 2. By Marriage: Shows spouse and children. 3. By Adoption: Shows guardian and adopted children. Eligibility: All family members must be registered with NADRA and possess valid 13-digit identification numbers. Unregistered members will not appear in the FRC. Application Methods: At NADRA Registration Center (NRC): - Receive token. - Photographs of minors taken. - Data entered and reviewed. - Printed FRC handed over in real time. - For children under 18, their presence is required. Through Pak ID Mobile App: - Apply online through Pak ID platform. - Upload data and verify details. - FRC PDF sent via email within 24 hours to 2 working days. Documents Required: - CNIC/CRC/NICOP/POC numbers of family members. - Correct spellings as per NADRA record. - Photographs of applicant and minors (<18 years). - Unregistered family members must update CNIC before linking. Restrictions: Only English name spellings can be corrected. Name changes of family members are not permitted within FRC. Delivery Time: - Through NRC: Issued immediately. - Through Pak ID: Delivered by email within 1–2 working days.

text: Purpose: The Juvenile Card is a secure, chip-based identity document issued by NADRA to children under the age of 18. It serves as an official identity document, unlike the Child Registration Certificate (CRC), and grants access to multiple public services and facilities. Eligibility: - Pakistani citizens under 18 years of age. - Must have at least one parent or legal guardian with a valid CNIC or NICOP. - Applicant must be physically present at the NADRA Registration Center (NRC). Requirements: - Presence of a parent or blood relative (father, mother, brother, sister, daughter, or son) with a valid CNIC to provide biometrics. - Original birth certificate or valid CRC of the applicant. - Application must be submitted in person; no online service is available for Juvenile Cards. How to Apply at NADRA Registration Center (NRC): 1. Visit any NADRA Registration Center. 2. Receive a token upon arrival. 3. Photograph, fingerprints, and signature of the child will be captured. 4. Required data will be entered and printed for review. 5. Review printed form for accuracy. 6. Get the form attested by a blood relative or gazetted officer. 7. Submit the attested form back to the NRC for processing. Processing & Delivery Time: - Normal: 31 days - Urgent: 15 days - Fast Track: 9 days (priority queue and expedited processing) Note: Processing time starts only after submission of the attested form. Online application via Pak ID Mobile App is currently not available for Juvenile Cards.

text: Purpose: The Succession Certificate program enables legal heirs to obtain Letters of Administration or Succession Certificates through NADRA without having to approach the courts. This initiative streamlines inheritance matters for Pakistani citizens and significantly reduces the judicial burden. Background: Launched in January 2021, the NADRA Succession Certificate system introduced a simplified, technology-driven process to issue inheritance certificates in a transparent and efficient manner. It has reduced the judiciary’s workload by nearly 30%. Key Features: - Simplified Process: A five-step process replaces lengthy court visits. - Efficiency: Considerably faster than traditional court procedures. - Transparency: Ensures secure verification and issuance. - Convenience: Applicants can complete the process at NADRA centers instead of courts. - Accessibility: Available at district-level NADRA offices in multiple provinces. Benefits: - Eliminates the need for lengthy and costly court proceedings. - Ensures transparent and reliable verification of legal heirs. - Reduces overall time and effort for applicants. - Provides official documentation recognized by relevant institutions. Regions Where Service Is Available: - Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) - Punjab - Sindh - Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) Note: The Succession Certificate program will be expanded to additional regions across Pakistan. Applicants are advised to visit NADRA’s official website for the latest updates and availability.

text: Purpose: The National Identity Card (CNIC) is the official identification document for Pakistani citizens aged 18 years and above. It establishes identity, citizenship, and eligibility for government services and benefits. NADRA issues, renews, modifies, and cancels CNICs under clearly defined processes.

text: Purpose: To renew an expired CNIC or one that is nearing expiry while maintaining the same personal information. Documents Required: - Scanned image of existing CNIC or NICOP. Details: - Only the photograph will be updated during renewal. - If you wish to change any information (name, address, marital status, etc.), apply under the Modification category instead.

text: Purpose: To update or correct information on an existing CNIC. Modification Types and Requirements: 1. Name Change - Name change not allowed in online applications. - Visit nearest NADRA Registration Center (NRC). 2. Parent Name - Not allowed in online applications. - Visit nearest NADRA Registration Center (NRC). 3. Date of Birth (D.O.B) - Cannot be modified online. - Visit NRC for manual correction. 4. Present/Temporary Address Modification - No document required if adding a house and street number. - For unnumbered addresses, acceptable documents include: - Utility bill (electricity, gas, water) - Property document - Verified Local/Domicile/PRC Certificate - Affidavit or Rent Deed verified by house owner - Spouse’s or parent’s ID card with same address 5. Marital Status Modification - **Marriage:** Nikkahnama / Marriage Certificate / Affidavit attested by Oath Commissioner and spouse CNIC. - **Divorce:** Divorce Certificate from Union Council. - **Widow:** Death Certificate of spouse or attested affidavit. - **Unmarried to Widow/Divorce:** Marriage or Divorce Certificate / Court Decree / Affidavit. - Female applicants can only change status from *Married* to *Widowed*. 6. Religion Modification - **To Islam:** No document required. Reversion to Islam allowed anytime. - **From Islam to another religion:** Declaration/Undertaking form required. (Modification not allowed if declaration of being Muslim was made after 13 Dec 2018.) 7. Place of Birth Modification - Requires documentary evidence for country change. 8. Mother Details - For first-time addition, scanned copies of mother’s and sibling’s ID cards required. 9. Mother Tongue, Mark of ID, Qualification, Profession, Contact, and Relative Details - No document required unless requested by NADRA. 10. Disability Addition - Disability certificate from NCRDP/PCRDP or relevant social welfare authority required.

text: Purpose: To formally cancel an existing CNIC in cases of death, nationality surrender, or dual nationality status. Types of Cancellation: 1. **Due to Death** - Immediate family member submits: - Cut (destroyed) CNIC of deceased - Death Certificate - Affidavit/Undertaking confirming death 2. **Due to Nationality Surrender** - Applicable when a citizen acquires a foreign passport and renounces Pakistani nationality. - Documents required: - Original CNIC/CRC/NICOP - Renunciation Certificate of Pakistani Nationality or valid foreign passport (non-dual nationality country). 3. **Due to Dual Nationality or Reacquired Nationality** - Applicable for ex-Pakistanis reacquiring Pakistani nationality or when a dual-nationality agreement is announced with their current country. 4. **Duplicate ID Cards (DUP Status)** - Citizens with multiple CNICs must visit NADRA or email **dup.op@nadra.gov.pk** for resolution.

text: Purpose: To upgrade an existing application from **Normal** or **Urgent** to **Executive** for faster processing. Steps to Expedite: 1. Log in to your Pak ID account. 2. Accept terms and conditions and select the S/CNIC tab. 3. Choose “I want to expedite my application.” 4. Enter tracking ID and proceed. 5. Pay the additional fee via credit card. 6. Receive an auto-generated acknowledgment from NADRA.

text: Purpose: The Pakistan Origin Card (POC) is an identification document issued by NADRA to Pakistani-origin citizens living abroad. It establishes the holder’s Pakistani origin and enables access to certain rights and benefits.
text_ur: مقصد: پاکستانی شہریوں کی طرف سے جاری کردہ ایک شناختی دستاویز ہے جس نے پاکستانی شہریوں کو جاری کیا اور یہ کچھ حقوق اور فوائد تک رسائی حاصل کرنے کے قابل ہے۔

text: Purpose: To apply for a new Pakistan Origin Card based on one of four grounds: parents/grandparents, Pakistani spouse, ex-Pakistani, or Foreigner of Pakistani Origin (FPO). Documents Required: - Form 'Y' declaration in quadruplicate - Original Renunciation Certificate - Copies of CNIC/NICOP/POC - Additional documents may be requested by the Case Officer Eligibility Scenarios: 1. Dual National Passport Holder: - Cancel existing CNIC/NICOP before applying. 2. Parents/Grandparents Basis: - Valid foreign passport of applicant - CNIC/NICOP/POC/Pakistani Passport/MNIC/Domicile/Citizenship certificate of (grand)parents - Birth Certificate or documents linking applicant to parents - CNIC/NICOP of siblings/aunts/uncles/cousins with statement confirming relationship 3. Pakistani Spouse Basis: - Valid foreign passport - CNIC/NICOP/POC of Pakistani spouse - Marriage Certificate and Affidavit from spouse - For deceased spouse: Death Certificate and affidavit attested by Pakistan Mission 4. Ex-Pakistani: - Valid foreign passport - CNIC/NICOP/Pakistani Passport/MNIC/Domicile/Citizenship Certificate/Renunciation Certificate - Additional documents for those from East Pakistan pre-16 Dec 1971 5. Foreigner of Pakistani Origin (FPO): - Valid foreign passport - Birth Certificate or document containing parent(s) names - Affidavit/Death certificate of FPO with ID documents Dual National Countries (Partial List): Australia, Belgium, Canada, Egypt, France, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Jordan, Netherlands, New Zealand, Sweden, Switzerland, Syria, UK, USA, Bahrain, Finland, Denmark, Germany*, Norway *Germany: Only children of Pakistani nationals born in Germany who acquired German nationality.

text: Purpose: To renew an expired POC or one that is nearing expiry. Documents Required: - Form 'Y' declaration in quadruplicate - Original Renunciation Certificate - Copies of CNIC/NICOP/POC - Valid foreign passport (not expired) - Affidavit depending on spouse status - Police Clearance Report if required Notes: - Cannot renew POC with expired foreign passport - POC issued before 2008 may require additional documents depending on policy
text_ur: مقصد: غیر موجود دستاویزات کو دوبارہ بحال کرنے کے لئے، یا ایک ایسا شخص جو قریبی قریبی ہے. اس سے توقع کی جا سکتی ہے کہ وہ غیر ملکی تنظیم کا اعلان کرے.

Permanent Pakistani Address - POC + NICOP/POC of relatives/spouse OR Property/Tenancy documents OR affidavits 4. document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: The NICOP/SNICOP is an official identity card issued by NADRA to Pakistani citizens living abroad. It establishes identity, nationality, and eligibility for government services and travel purposes.

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: To apply for a replacement of a stolen or lost NICOP. Documents Required: 1. Applying from Single National Country (Non-dual nationality countries): - Pakistani Passport OR if not available, Undertaking from 2 witnesses 2. Applying from Dual National Countries: - Foreign or Pakistani Passport OR if not available, Undertaking from 2 witnesses - Note: For Germany, applicable only for children born from Pakistani parent and raised in Germany
text_ur: مقصد: ایک چوری یا گم شدہ قانون کے مطابق عمل کرنے کے لئے مجبور کیا گیا ہے: اقوام متحدہ میں سے 1: 1 ملک (ا 28 ملک) (اس میں) پیروی کریں، اگر پاکستانی حکومت کے گواہوں کی طرف سے دستیاب نہ ہو یا پھر ان کے گواہوں کی طرف سے شائع ہونے والے گواہوں کی جانب سے شائع نہ ہو تو غور کریں کہ جرمنی اور غیر ملکی بچوں کے لئے غیر ملکی اور غیر ملکی بچوں کی پرورش کے لئے تیار کی گئی ہے۔

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: To renew an existing NICOP while keeping personal information unchanged. Documents Required: - Form 'Y' declaration in quadruplicate - Original Renunciation Certificate - Scanned image of existing NICOP/CNIC - Valid foreign or Pakistani passport (as per nationality rules) - For single national countries, attested Undertaking from 2 witnesses if passport not available Notes: - Only the photograph will be updated - No document required for foreign address modification - To modify other fields, apply under Modification category
text_ur: مقصد: ذاتی معلومات کو قائم رکھنے کے لئے قبل اس کے کہ اب تک موجود ہیں ذاتی معلومات کو قائم رکھنے کے لئے غلطی: '%s' کی بنیاد قائم رکھنے کا حکم دیا گیا ہے.
document_title_ur: مختلف طریقوں سے امدادی امدادی امداد ( بخشدـنـن)
summary_ur: مقصد: ذاتی معلومات کو برقرار رکھنے کے لئے قبلائی معلومات کو عمل میں لانے کے لئے آپ کی منتخب کردہ معلومات درکار ہیں: '%s'

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: To update or correct personal information on an existing NICOP. Modification Types and Requirements: 1. Date of Birth (D.O.B) - Age change up to or more than 5 years: Valid foreign documents (Passport/Resident Permit/Work Permit/PR Card/Sojourn/Green Card) - Age change up to 5 years: Pakistani Passport OR Matric Certificate/Mark Sheet OR Service Book - Second-time age change (max 366 days): Valid Pakistani or foreign documents - One-year change allowed via Birth Certificate - Minor adjustments for siblings or day/month changes: No documents required 2. Applicant Name - Complete name change: Undertaking notarized by local attorney or attested by Pakistan Mission + Pakistani or foreign documents - Name change due to religion change: Certificate from Dar-Ul-Afta/Islamic Centre (only to Islam) - Minor name change (remove/add part of name): Valid Pakistani or foreign document OR Matric Certificate OR Undertaking - Partial name change (caste only): No documents required - Note: Name change cannot be reverted or modified a second time, except for female applicants (husband/father) 3. Parents Name - Minor correction: CNIC/NICOP data OR educational document OR passport with desired parent name - Complete correction: MNIC (Rg1/Rg3) OR old B-form OR old Pakistani Passport OR Matric Certificate 4. Present/Permanent Address - Present/Temporary Address: Parents/siblings/children/spouse’s ID cards OR utility bill OR property documents OR rent deed/affidavit - Permanent Address: Scanned images of blood relative/spouse ID cards OR utility bill OR property documents OR verified local/domicile/PRC certificate - Note: No document required for present foreign address 5. Marital Status - Marriage: Nikahnama / Marriage Certificate OR notarized/attested by Pakistan Mission + spouse CNIC - Divorce: Divorce Certificate OR Final Court Order/Absolute Decree/Undertaking - Widow: Death Certificate of spouse OR notarized/attested affidavit - Unmarried to Widow/Divorce: Marriage/Divorce Certificate + affidavit - Male applicants can modify all marital statuses; female applicants only Married → Widowed 6. Religion - From other religion to Islam: Undertaking or Certificate from Dar-Ul-Afta/Islamic Centre - From Islam to other religion: Declaration/undertaking (only allowed if initial declaration before 13 Dec 2018) 7. Place of Birth (Country) - Documentary evidence required for country change 8. Mother Details - First-time addition: Scanned images of mother and sibling ID cards - Minor change: Scanned mother and sibling ID cards - Complete change: Scanned MNIC (Rg1/Rg3), old B-form, or old Pakistani Passport 9. Mother Language, Mark of ID, Qualification, Profession, Contact, Relative Details - No document required 10. Disability - Blind, Physical Disability, Mentally Retarded, Hearing Impaired - Disability certificate from NCRDP/PCRDP or social welfare authority required
text_ur: جائزے : ڈی وی ڈی ایم ایم ایم اے سی ایس ایس ایس سی : : پبلک لائسنس ( ناحق ) یا تو مہینے میں اپنی مرضی سے طلاق دے سکتے ہیں یا پھر اِن کا حق ادا کر سکتے ہیں : اِن کا نام ایسی صورت میں بدل سکتے ہیں جن کا نام ایسی عورتوں سے لیا گیا ہے : جن کا خاوند یا پھر اِدارے یا جن کے ماں باپ ہو یا پھر اِس کے بیٹے یا بھائی یا پھر اِن کے بیٹے یا پھر اِدارے یا پھر اِدار عورتیں ، اِس وصیت پر عمل کرنے کے بعد آپس کی حالت میں بدل سکتے ہیں : اِن پر ظلم نہ کِیا کرو ۔

summary_ur: مقصد : موجودہ زمانے پر کسی بھی قسم کی ذاتی معلومات کو تبدیل کرنا یا اسے درست کرنا : ڈی وی پی این کی تاریخ اور اس سے بھی زیادہ سالوں تک تبدیل کرنا

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: To cancel an existing NICOP due to nationality change, dual nationality, or death. Documents Required: 1. For nationality change (non-dual country): - Original NICOP + Renunciation Certificate OR Valid foreign passport 2. If not formally renounced Pakistani nationality: - Apply via Pakistani Consulate or IMPASS to renounce nationality 3. Deceased Family Member: - Cut image of deceased ID into two pieces - Death Certificate of deceased - Affidavit/Undertaking confirming death

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: For minors (under 18) or adults registering for NICOP for the first time. Documents Required: 1. Minors (up to 18 years) - B-Form OR Detailed Birth Certificate OR S-1 Form issued by Pak Mission OR Citizenship Certificate OR Pakistani Passport - Foreign/Pakistani passport/Resident card/PR card/Travel Document (3-year exemption for minors born abroad) - Scanned images of CNIC/NICOP of parent/sibling/grandparents 2. Applicants 18+ registering for the first time - B-Form OR Detailed Birth Certificate OR A/O Level OR Matric OR MNIC OR Domicile OR Citizenship Certificate OR any passport as proof of birth and parentage - Scanned CNIC/NICOP of parents/immediate blood relatives OR Undertaking with 2 witnesses + scanned IDs and passports of witnesses - If married: Nikahnama OR Marriage Certificate OR Affidavit attested by Pak Mission/notarized

document_title: NATIONAL IDENTITY CARD FOR OVERSEAS PAKISTANIS (NICOP/SNICOP)
text: Purpose: To upgrade an existing NICOP application from Normal/Urgent to Executive for faster processing. Steps to Expedite: 1. Login to Pak ID account 2. Accept terms and select S/CNIC-S/NICOP tab 3. Click “I want to expedite my application” 4. Enter Tracking ID and press “Next” 5. Pay additional fee via credit card 6. Receive auto-generated acknowledgment from NADRA
text_ur: مقصد : قائم کردہ حصّے سے آگے بڑھ جانے کے لیے اپر پبلک لائسنس کی شرائط پر عمل کرنے کے لیے فائل ڈِکِن اے سی پی این سی پی این سی پی اے سی پی این ایس پی اے سی پی ایس پی پتہ : ” مجھے اپنی پی ایس پی ایس سی پی کو تبدیل کرنے کے لیے وضع کریں اور اپنی ایس پی این ایس پی پر کلک کریں ” میں اپنا بٹن پی این ایس پی پر کلک کرنا چاہتا ہوں “ اور اسکے نتیجے پر مزید اطلاق کرنا چاہتا ہوں : ” مجھے اپنا داياں داخل کرنے کے لیے وی پی این پی این ایس پی این پی پی این ایس پی سی پی امت منتخب کر نا عوامی رکھ سکتے ہیں ۔

summary_ur: مقصد: قائم کرنے کے لیے غیر موجود فائل حذف کرنے کی ذمہ داری ختم کرنے کے لیے قبل اس کے کہ پبلک لائسنس کی طرف سے جاری کردہ ہدایات دریافت کرنے کے لیے دوبارہ سے درخواست کی جا سکتی ہے: 'جیسے اتصال 1 / 1 کو تبدیل کرتا ہے. تب تک نام تبدیل کریں اور فائل تبدیل کریں.
